Re: License #: CB381002610
Dear Ms. Dindoffer:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
My Place is located in downtown Jackson, Michigan. The agency has been in
operation since 2021 as a resource for Jackson County DHHS youth to receive
community-based services and Independent Living (IL) housing. At this time, the
2

agency wishes to gain licensure in order to accept the IL cases from DHHS with
case management responsibilities.
The agency has a rental agreement for two houses. The rental agreement is
open-ended with a clause that either party will need to provide 6 months’ notice to
terminate the agreement. A walk-through of both houses occurred on 4/14/25.
Both homes were in excellent condition with appropriate furniture. Both homes
had adequate space, including the living room, dining area, kitchen, laundry, and
storage areas. One home is currently used to house six female IL youth. The
other home will be used to house four male IL youth.
The agency’s office is in the house located at 406 S. Blackstone. The office has
locking doors, locking file cabinets, and sufficient space for staff to work and meet
with youth or agency partners.
B. Program Description
The My Place program is designed for Independent Living eligible DHHS youth
ages 16- 21. The program will provide safe, stable housing, and supportive
services. The agency will provide housing, community support services, and case
management services for youth in foster care or Young Adult Voluntary Foster
Care (YAVFC) through MDHHS. Youth must meet eligibility criteria for the IL
program as outlined in the agency’s Program Statement and agree to follow
agency policies and procedures.
As My Place will not be staffed twenty-four hours a day, the agency expects youth
to be able to care for themselves independently and safely. Youth must be able to
use public transportation, be home alone, safely use a stove/oven/microwave,
complete chores, practice personal hygiene, engage in school, work or other
community services. Youth must be working or engaging in school with progress
toward a high school diploma or Graduate Equivalency Degree (GED). Youth
must be willing to engage in regular mental health services as recommended by
mental health professionals. Youth must not be actively battling a substance use
disorder and must have a minimum of three months sobriety following substance
use disorder. Youth must not be an active threat of harm to themselves or others
and must not have a history of criminal sexual conduct.
The agency Program Statement, policies/procedures, forms, job descriptions, and
budget were reviewed and found to be in compliance with licensing rules. The
agency will operate with a Chief Administrator/Supervisor and one Case Manager
initially. Additional support staff will be hired as needed, based on the number of
youth served. The CA/Supervisor and Case Manager have registered to complete
CWTI training. The agency is aware of the caseload size restrictions in place
while completing CWTI training.
Financially, the program is currently funded through donations, grants, and
community partnerships. With the licensed IL program, the agency will also
3

receive the MDHHS Administrative Rate. While My Place will not rely on the
MDHHS administrative rate, this income will be added to the projected budget
once the license is approved. The projected budget for 2025 was reviewed; no
concerns were noted.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all licensing rules and statues.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
___________July 11, 2025_____________________
